intro: Barleria macrolemma, commonly known as the red barleria, is a flowering plant native to southern Africa. It is a perennial herb that typically grows to a height of about 30–60 centimeters. The plant features slender, branching stems and lance-shaped leaves with a slightly hairy surface. Its striking flowers are usually bright red or orange, arranged in dense clusters at the ends of the stems. Barleria macrolemma is often cultivated in gardens for its ornamental value and ability to thrive in sunny, well-drained conditions.
